definition: the local commander/provincial governor (in Qing and Ming times)
to carry (hanging down from the hand)/to lift/to put forward/to mention/to raise (an issue)/upwards character stroke/lifting brush stroke (in painting)/scoop for measuring liquid

sentences.english: Generals and Admirals can make or break a military.
sentences.chinese: 將軍和提督能左右着一支軍隊。

sentences.english: This was the Northern Navy commander's office, or commonly known as the Navy Yamen.
sentences.chinese: 這兒就是當年的北洋水師提督署，俗稱水師衙門。

sentences.english: The ship is commanded by the general.
His father and his paternal grandfather both became four-star United States Navy admirals.
sentences.chinese: 他父親和祖父都成爲四星級的美國海軍提督。

sentences.english: Admiral Yamen is 200 meters outside the Southwest Admiral Ding Yu's apartment.
sentences.chinese: 提督衙門外西南200米處是水師提督丁汝昌的寓所。

sentences.english: Admiral Yamen is 200 meters outside the Southwest Admiral Ding Yu's apartment.
sentences.chinese: 提督衙門外西南200米處是水師提督丁汝昌的寓所。

definition: inspector-general of province in Ming and Qing times
(army) commander-in-chief (archaic)/provincial military governor and civil administrator during the early Republic of China era (1911-1949 AD)
to garrison/to stand guard/on garrison duty
senior official/senior officer/commanding officer/CL:位[wei4]/sir (term of address for senior officer)
army regiment at the disposal of province governor-general
provincial military governor during the early Republic of China era (1911-1949 AD)
